channel.title: Digg Top Stories
channel.description: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

item.title: Nigeria May Be Out Of The World Cup, But Their Jersey Will Still Be Coveted
item.description: The team's sold-out-everywhere streetwear crossover enriched more than the tournament's style.

item.title: Annoyed Michigan Mayor Begs Constituents To Not Pester Him While He Jogs
item.description: Jim Fouts, the mayor of Warren, Michigan, has a problem â€” well actually, he's had several, but the most recent involves getting stopped on his twice-daily run by a concerned citizen.

item.title: The Story Of The Nirvana Baby, Plus Other Iconic Album Covers
item.description: That's not a stock image, they really threw a baby in the pool. What's more grunge than that?

item.title: There's A Better Way To Handle Student Loans, And It's This
item.description: Built from (very) personal experiences with student debt, CommonBond has created a better way to manage education expenses. CommonBond refinancing is pretty simple: take out a new loan â€“ at a lower interest rate â€“ to consolidate and replace your old loans. With three refinancing options, you can save tens of thousands of dollars simply by switching.

item.title: The Psychology Of Why You Feel Alone Even When Youâ€™re Surrounded By People
item.description: Despite the world's population creeping upward by around 200,000 people a day, many of us have never felt as alone.

item.title: The Old Timey Nicknames Of American Mobsters
item.description: Last Friday, Francis "Cadillac Frank" Salemme wasÂ found guiltyÂ of killing a South Boston nightclub owner 25 years ago. And while the crimes of Cadillac Frank and his contemporaries were heinous, their nicknames were undeniably cool.

item.title: California Has 48 Hours To Pass This Privacy Bill Or Else
item.description: Recent headlines have suggested that California lawmakers are considering a bill that would give Californians "unprecedented control over their data." This is true but that is not the whole story.

item.title: Today's Kids Are Not Very Impressed By Kids' Foods From The '90s
item.description: These sophisticated consumers know a choking hazard when they see one.

item.title: The Time Might Finally Be Right For 'Dragon Quest' To Become A Worldwide Hit
item.description: Though the series has long been a staple in Japan since its inception in 1989, it has struggled to garner much of a global audience â€” and series executive producer Yuu Miyake believes missing that early PlayStation window is one of the major culprits.

item.title: Good Design Is Good Policy
item.description: Can you redesign an entire generation? Leave it to Tishaura Jones, the first female treasurer of St. Louis, to try.

item.title: Zen Out To This Dude Silently Making A Margherita Pizza
item.description: The rest of the world fades away as this man makes and kneads the dough, crack opens a can of tomatoes and assembles one beautiful pie.

item.title: I Unfollowed My Boyfriend On Twitter To Save Our Relationship
item.description: Greg (a pseudonym, because I wouldn't want him to get any new followers out of this) was capital-O Online. He was a Twitter power-user. He'd even secured his job at a prestigious magazine through his active presence on the site.

item.title: The Rise Of DNA Data Storage
item.description: Could DNA as an archival medium be the solution to our information overload?

item.title: Thereâ€™s A Better Way to Handle Student Loans, And Itâ€™s This
item.description: Built from (very) personal experiences with student debt, CommonBond has created a better way to manage education expenses. CommonBond refinancing is pretty simple: take out a new loan â€“ at a lower interest rate â€“ to consolidate and replace your old loans. With three refinancing options, you can save tens of thousands of dollars simply by switching.

item.title: What's Going On With Buzz Aldrin?
item.description: The Apollo astronaut is suing his children and longtime manager â€” but no one can agree on the truth.

item.title: WeRateDogs Is Once Again In Hot Water On Twitter
item.description: Want to operate a successful social media account dedicated to pets? First, take a long hard look in the mirror and ask yourself: "Am I dumb enough to screw this up by being racist?"

item.title: Dude Spends Hours And Hours Making Tires Out Of Electrical Tape, Takes His Car For A Wild Ride
item.description: It becomes glaringly apparent that this is not a safe alternative for those looking to avoid buying tires.

item.title: Twenty-Seven Sydney Men Were Probably Murdered Because They Were Gay, Police Say
item.description: The unsolved homicide unit is now examining 23 cases with fears that homophobic killers may still walk the streets.

item.title: Seventeen US States Sue The Trump Administration Over Family Separations
item.description: It is the first legal challenge over family separation from the states, who argue that the president's executive order denies migrant families due process and the right to seek asylum.

item.title: Why Pay For $2000 A Gaming PC And Oculus Rift When You Could Win It For Free?
item.description: We're giving away a $1200 Acer Aspire gaming PC, a $400 Oculus Rift VR headset, a $300 Asus gaming monitor and a $100 gaming keyboard and mouse. Enter here to win.

item.title: How To Forgive Your Father
item.description: My immigrant father was trying to navigate life in a new and scary world. And I was hellbent on making things as difficult as possible.

item.title: Here's What Happens When You Miss Your Parkour Toehold
item.description: This guy knocked the wind â€” and to be honest, probably a whole lot more â€” out of himself.

item.title: The Most Ambitious Headphones In The World
item.description: The Vinci 2.0 is less a headphone and more a computer that sits on your head. Combining the functionality of sport headphones with a smartphone,Â fitness tracker and Alexa-enabled speaker, these â€œheadphonesâ€ are unlike anything else on the market today.

item.title: How Can We Make Technology Healthier For Humans?
item.description: Unplugging wholesale is not an option. Nor for most of us is it an appropriate response to life in the age of technology. The question then becomes how to selectively unplug.

item.title: 'Detroit', 'Westworld' And Moving Androids Beyond Human
item.description: We live in an era where it's completely mundane to ask talking boxes for trivia answers and maintain digital extensions of our personae on websites accessed through portable phones. We are not as suspicious of technology as we once were. It's a part of us now â€” something we live with.

item.title: Holy Shit, Look At This Massive Race Car Pileup
item.description: Not a single car escaped unscathed from this Portuguese street circuit race for the FIA World Touring Car Cup.

item.title: Inside The Investor Revolt That's Trying To Take Down Mark Zuckerberg
item.description: Facebook investors boasting nearly $3 billion in shares are making moves to topple Mark Zuckerberg as chairman and tear apart his power base at the company.

item.title: The Nuclear Bunker In 'Europe's North Korea'
item.description: Communist Albania was Europe's most isolated nation. Fearing invasion, its regime built a top-secret nuclear bunker. Today that bunker is an eerie tourist attraction.

item.title: Baby Spitting Cobras Are Apparently Very, Very Cute
item.description: We're certain that cobras are terrifying and dangerous. But we're also completely positive that baby cobras are lovable and that they'll never turn on us.

item.title: Which Parts Of The US Are Losing And Gaining Wealth The Fastest, Mapped
item.description: When you look at income growth rate, the picture suddenly seems less rosy for places in New York and the Bay Area.

item.title: The Gospel Of Elon Musk, According To His Flock
item.description: Musketeers believe he will save the world. What does that mean for the rest of us?

item.title: Heron Makes The Unfortunate Mistake Of Landing In A Zoo's Lion Enclosure
item.description: A caged lion is still a powerful hunter, sadly for this heron that wandered into the Amsterdam Zoo.

item.title: It's So Stupid That We Don't See Female Body Hair In Shaving Ads
item.description: Women's razor startup company Billie is showing close-ups of armpit hair, belly hair and toe fuzz.

item.title: I'm Starting To Have Serious Doubts About Amazon Prime
item.description: It's not so much that Prime is a good deal. It's that Prime is a great trick.

item.title: Here's Argentina's Late, Late Goal To Avoid Elimination
item.description: In an absolute heart-breaker for Nigeria, Argentina's Marcos Rojo slotted home a cross in the 86th minute to go up 2-1. With the result, Argentina advances to the knockout rounds.

item.title: The Biggest Digital Heist In History Isn't Over Yet
item.description: Carbanak's suspected ringleader is under arrest, but $1.2 billion remains missing, and his malware attacks live on.

item.title: Jonathan Franzen Is Fine With All Of It
item.description: The internet has turned on him, his book sales are down and the TV adaptation of his last novel has stalled. But he wants you to know one thing: He's not even angry.

item.title: Everything You Need To Know About The Disastrous TanaCon, This Year's Fyre Fest
item.description: A popular YouTuber's conference was a poorly executed mess that left fans stranded under the Southern California sun without food or water and that got cancelled after less than a day due to a lack of capacity for attendees at the conference venue.

item.title: This House's Backyard Pool Cover Is Ingenious
item.description: Climb on in, the water's extra fine.

item.title: The Cruel (But Effective) Agony Of The Kars4Kids Jingle
item.description: 1-877-Kars-4-Kids, K-A-R-S Kars for Kids, 1-EIGHT-SEVEN-SEVEN-Kars-4-Kids, Donate Your Car Today â€¦

item.title: Diego Maradona's Celebration Of Argentina's Win Over Nigeria Was Something Else
item.description: After Marcos Rojo scored a last-minute goal to take Argentina past Nigeria to the Round of 16, Maradona gave a triumphant double-finger to Nigeria's fans.

item.title: Jimmy Carter For Higher Office
item.description: To gaze upon Jimmy Carter, to look upon a face marked by time â€” the charismatic handsomeness of his 50s has softened, hollowed, and transformed into the weatherworn visage of his 90s â€” is to see someone shorn of ambition, trying to tell a truth, orÂ hisÂ truth.

item.title: Real-Life SchrÃ¶dinger's Cats Probe The Boundary Of The Quantum World
item.description: Recent experiments have put relatively large objects into quantum states, illuminating the processes by which the ordinary world emerges out of the quantum one.

item.title: Lionel Messi Scores A Beauty To Put Argentina Up 1-0 Over Nigeria
item.description: If the result holds, Argentina needs an Iceland draw or loss to ensure they advance.

item.title: Second Spanish Church Falls Prey To Well-Intentioned Restorer
item.description: An attempt to freshen up the 16th-century polychrome statue has left St. George with a rosy pink face and a bold, red-and-gray suit of armor. The restoration is believed to have been carried out by a handicrafts teacher at the request of the parish authorities of the Church of St. Michael.

item.title: You Can't Hurt Lindsay Lohan Now
item.description: Once America's favorite troubled teen, treated with scorn and sexism, our greatest export reveals she's in a better place now. (It's called Lohan Beach House.)

item.title: Guy Flies His Hot Air Balloon Directly Into A Power Line, And Then A Lake
item.description: Somehow, after running into a live power line and landing in a lake, the pilot was okay.

item.title: Half Off Some $800 Suits, H*ck Yeah
item.description: Indochinoâ€™s process is simple: Choose your fabric, customize your style and submit your measurements. Right now, you can get one of their premium made-to-measure suits (which usually cost $800) for $379 when you use the promo code DIGG.

item.title: This 'Let's Play' Parody From The Creator Of 'Too Many Cooks' Will Delight And Disturb You
item.description: Much like with "Too Many Cooks," to say much more about Casper Kelly's "Final Deployment 4" other than "you should watch it" this would rob this bizarre experience of its potency.

item.title: All The Latest Cryptocurrency News, In One Place
item.description: Interested in cryptocurrency? Our algorithmic channel pulls in all the latest stories about Bitcoin, Ethereum and more from around the internet.

item.title: The Best Long Reads From Around The Internet
item.description: Find all the best new longform writing on the internet right here.

item.description: There's a lot going on right now, and you can follow it all here â€” tweets, stories and more.
